page.title: 01KILMERSDON SURROUNDING AREA
page.content:
Located in the Mendips in rolling countryside. Hedgerows, small fields, coppices and mixed farming preserve a "patchwork" effect of traditional English landscape. There is little intrusion of industry. Kilmersdon is an unspoilt typical old village with square, shop, pub, church; an Estate village most of which belongs to Ammerdown Estate owned by 5th Baron Hylton, Raymond Jolliffe. Charlton hamlet revitalized community with evident restoration. Newbury is a small farming hamlet.
Architecture - mediaeval to modern. Lias white limestone common.
Ammerdown and Babington are two historic houses with their Estates nearby.
